document.masterDocTitle: Four New Species Of Ptomaphagus From Costa Rica And Panama (Coleoptera: Leiodidae: Cholevinae: Ptomaphagini)

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 1. Habitus of
Ptomaphagus ( Tupania ) costarica
n. sp. Total body length 3.9 mm.

Figs. 2–6. Structures of
Ptomaphagus ( Tupania ) costarica
n. sp. 2) Dorsal view, left antenna; 3) lateral view, aedeagus; 4) dorsal view, apex of aedeagus; 5–6) spermatheca. Scale line for antenna and aedeagus 0.2 mm, for spermathecae 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Derivation of Name. The specific epithet refers to the country of Costa Rica and is used as a noun in apposition.

Diagnosis. This is the only species of the subgenus
Tupania
described from south of Mexico and north of Brazil (Peck et al. 1998). The subgenus is characterized by the flabellate antenna ( Figs. 1 , 2 ), whereas the subgenus
Adelops
lacks this antennal apomorphy. The species is characterized by the shape of the aedeagus and spermatheca.

Notes. This is the most frequently collected species of Costa Rican
Ptomaphagus
. All records are from forest and cloud-forest habitats, from 700 m to 1,920 m elevation, and from the months of February to July.
